message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.NE 

This paper is about training an LSTM language model for speech recognition, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses scaling out the learning process to leverage big data, which involves optimization techniques and machine learning algorithms, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions communication latency as a problem, which relates to distributed computing, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a decentralized BMUF process, which involves updating the model by communicating with randomly chosen neighbor nodes, which is related to neural networks and optimization, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
